text:
Oscars red carpet 2017: from Ruth Negga to Emma Stone - in pictures View more sharing options Close
As the stars arrive for the 89th Oscars in Los Angeles, the Guardian’s fashion team cast an eye over the looks that brought the red carpet to life
Hannah Marriott , Ellie Violet Bramley and Matt Fidler
Monday 27 February 2017 02.11 GMT Last modified on Monday 27 February 2017 02.27 GMT
Ruth Negga in a Valentino gown and the must-have accessory of the red carpet – the blue American Civil Liberties Union ribbon. She’s nominated for Best actress for her role in Loving Photograph: Frazer Harrison/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Isabelle Huppert, who is nominated for Best actress for her role in Elle, wore Armani Privé – and proved that sleeves are very much a Fashion Thing Photograph: David Fisher/REX/Shutterstock
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Ballerina-chic … star of Rogue One Felicity Jones in Dior on the red carpet Photograph: Frazer Harrison/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
The award for the person wearing the dress most like Trump’s Oval office curtains goes to … Dakota Johnson in Gucci Photograph: Ian West/PA
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Hailee Steinfeld is showing her true grit in this sheer Ralph & Russo gown Photograph: Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Actor Viggo Mortensen looked every inch the dapper twitcher in this Dior Homme suit complete with a bird pin badge Photograph: Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Trudie Styler takes pleats to their logical conclusion, accessorising her look with Sting, who accessorises his look with a skinny rock’n’roll scarf Photograph: David Fisher/REX/Shutterstock
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Sunny Pawar, the young star of the film Lion, looking adorbs in a tux and trainers on the red carpet Photograph: Frazer Harrison/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Shooting from the hip … Karlie Kloss wore her ACLU ribbon in an unexpected position on her Stella McCartney gown Photograph: David Fisher/REX/Shutterstock
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Actor Jackie Chan with some pandas in raincoats Photograph: Frazer Harrison/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Tale as old as time … Leslie Mann channelled Belle from Beauty and the Beast in one of the only La La Land yellow dresses of the evening, by Zac Posen Photograph: David Fisher/REX/Shutterstock
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Riz Ahmed in blue Ermenegildo Zegna Couture tux proving that blue tailoring is a bit of a thing right now Photograph: Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Andrew Garfield, who is nominated for Best actor for his role in Hacksaw Ridge, took the adage that you’re never fully dressed without a smile to heart Photograph: Valerie Macon/AFP/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Taraji P. Henson, star of Hidden Figures, is gobsmacking in diamonds, an Alberta Ferretti gown and one very well-oiled left leg Photograph: Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
John Legend and wife Chrissy Teigen being all cutesy. Appaz Legend is in Gucci and Teigen is in Zuhair Murad and - in case you missed it - they are both in love. Photograph: Valerie Macon/AFP/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Pharrell Williams and Mimi Valdes having a lol on the red carpet, and looking sharp at the same time. Meryl Streep might have fallen out with Karl Lagerfeld but this pair are wearing head-to-toe Chanel Photograph: Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Kirsten Dunst is elegant but perplexingly so, given her usual tendency towards subversive, edgy fashion. Still, if you are going to go all ladylike a classic Dior New Look 1950s shape gown is the way to do it. Photograph: Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Director Ava DuVernay Photograph: Frazer Harrison/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Nominee for Best Music Can’t Stop The Feeling from Trolls Justin Timberlake and his wife US actress Jessica Biel Photograph: Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Actor Emma Stone Photograph: Steve Granitz/WireImage
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Matt Damon and his wife Luciana Barroso Photograph: Valerie Macon/AFP/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Actor Dev Patel and Anita Patel Photograph: Frazer Harrison/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Alicia Vikander Photograph: Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Olivia Hamilton and La La Land Director Damien Chazelle Photograph: Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Viola Davis in custom colour-blocked Armani, shoulders out, fringe swept to the side. It’s difficult to argue with this look, so we won’t Photograph: Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Pretty standard tuxedo fare here, on Jeff Bridges, but it’s always nice to see The Dude out of his dressing gown (the lady in red is the very smiley Susan Bridges) Photograph: Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Brie Larson looks both Upper East side and witchy in Oscar de la Renta Photograph: Kevin Mazur/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Naomie Harris in one of the night’s most winning looks, a shimmering white frock that looks straight up brilliant and only gets better the more you know about it, being the red carpet debut of Raf Simons for Calvin Klein. Plus: she’s wearing mismatched shoes! It’s the final frontier of fashion Photograph: Steve Granitz/WireImage
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Casey Affleck and his facial hair work the red carpet. That is all Photograph: Ian West/PA
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Samuel L. Jackson, with his wife, LaTanya Richardson, confirming that blue tuxedos are an Oscars trend. Nice Photograph: Mike Nelson/EPA
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Having spectacularly fallen out with Karl Lagerfeld over getting dressed this evening , Meryl Streep looks pretty chill in royal blue Elie Saab Photograph: Christopher Polk/Getty Images
Facebook Twitter Pinterest
Fashion Oscars Awards and prizes
